alert.note: Alert for Hardin (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 12:10PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF HARDIN COUNTY THROUGH 1245 PM EDT... At 1210 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Alger, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Kenton, Ada, Dunkirk, Alger, Blanchard, Roundhead, Mount Victory, Mcguffey, Ridgeway, Patterson, Dola, Grant, Silver Creek, Jumbo, Huntersville, Pfeiffer, Walton, Hepburn, Mentzer and State Route 195 at State Route 235. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
